poem:
### Fragile Days

Among whispers of alleys  
and headlines,  
a name flickers—  
Virginia—  
caught in the web  
of tales untold.  
  
Blue sirens hum  
while the edge of breath  
teeters on dusk—  
life's thin line  
drawn in asphalt.  
  
Ephemeral paths—  
as morning light,  
she fades, yet lingers  
in the paper's embrace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Epstein and Prince Andrew accuser says she has days to live after bus crash Virginia Giuffre, a victim of the disgraced US financier Jeffrey Epstein who once alleged she was sexually trafficked to Britain’s Prince Andrew, says she has just days to live after being involved in a vehicle accident. “This year has been the worst start to a new year … I won’t bore anyone with the details, but I think it important to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
